description.plain:
Sara Kays is a singer, songwriter from a suburb in central Indiana.

She didn’t grow up in a musical family. By the age of thirteen, her mom bought her first guitar for her and she knew then that she wanted to make a career out of it. When she turned fourteen she started playing gigs and busked around her hometown in an attempt to gain experience and exposure.

Throughout high school, Sara was able to really find who she was as a singer, songwriter, and performer. She decided to move to Atlanta, Georgia after graduating to check out the music scene.

During this time, she played gigs and open mics, finished up her first year of college, and recorder/released her debut EP A House Too Big.

After a year in Atlanta, Sara decided to move to Nashville, Tennessee which she fell in love with when traveling there to record her EP.

Sara is currently in school & writing/recording her next release! Stay tuned :-)

Info obtained from her personal website.

body.plain:
Sara Kays is a singer, songwriter from a suburb in central Indiana.

She didn’t grow up in a musical family. By the age of thirteen, her mom bought her first guitar for her and she knew then that she wanted to make a career out of it. When she turned fourteen she started playing gigs and busked around her hometown in an attempt to gain experience and exposure.

Throughout high school, Sara was able to really find who she was as a singer, songwriter, and performer. She decided to move to Atlanta, Georgia after graduating to check out the music scene.

During this time, she played gigs and open mics, finished up her first year of college, and recorder/released her debut EP A House Too Big.

After a year in Atlanta, Sara decided to move to Nashville, Tennessee which she fell in love with when traveling there to record her EP.

Sara is currently in school & writing/recording her next release! Stay tuned :-)

Info obtained from her personal website.

songs.full_title: Remember That Night? by Sara Kays
songs.title: Remember That Night?

description.plain:
Detailing the pain of heartbreak over the strumming  of a guitar, Sara Kays exploded with popularity following the release of “Remember That Night?” Sara recounts the emotions felt after a year-long relationship came to an end, taking the listener through the misery immediately after the couple broke up, the struggle of trying to move on from her ex in the following months, and having to go through all the heartache again after her ex reached out trying to reconnect.

Originally teased on TikTok on October 28, 2020, Sara quickly recorded and published the song after the TikTok went viral with fans begging for the song’s release. The song has amassed over 90 million streams on Spotify alone, quickly becoming Sara’s most popular song.

songs.embed_content: Read “Remember That Night?” by Sara Kays on Genius

annotatable.title: Remember That Night?

body.plain:
Detailing the pain of heartbreak over the strumming  of a guitar, Sara Kays exploded with popularity following the release of “Remember That Night?” Sara recounts the emotions felt after a year-long relationship came to an end, taking the listener through the misery immediately after the couple broke up, the struggle of trying to move on from her ex in the following months, and having to go through all the heartache again after her ex reached out trying to reconnect.

Originally teased on TikTok on October 28, 2020, Sara quickly recorded and published the song after the TikTok went viral with fans begging for the song’s release. The song has amassed over 90 million streams on Spotify alone, quickly becoming Sara’s most popular song.

songs.lyrics:
23 ContributorsRemember That Night? Lyrics[Verse 1]
The day after you said, "Goodbye"
All I did was lay in bed and cry
But after one month, I started to move on
And after two, I felt alright
Then three months in, you were off my mind

[Pre-Chorus]
And month four and five, I was living my life
I was better and didn't have to try
Not to think of you, until you reached out and said
"Remember that night?"

[Chorus]
We went for a drive, 2:30 in the morning
I kissed you, it was pouring
We held each other tight
Before the night was over
You looked over your shoulder
Oh, I was doing fine
You said, "Remember that night? Remember that night?"
Oh, I was doing fine
You said, "Remember that night? Remember that night?"

[Verse 2]
The day after you had reached out
I was broken for the second time around
I prayed on the third day that I would be okay
That I'd forget you were ever mine
Oh, I don't think you realize
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
How long I had to fight to be living my life
To get better and never have to try
Not to think of you, until you reached out and said
"Remember that night?"

[Chorus]
We went for a drive, 2:30 in the morning
I kissed you, it was pouring
We held each other tight
Before the night was over
You looked over your shoulder
Oh, I was doing fine
You said, "Remember that night? Remember that night?"
Oh, I was doing fine
You said, "Remember that night? Remember that night?"

[Bridge]
Do you remember?
Remember?

[Chorus]
We went for a drive, 2:30 in the morning
I kissed you, it was pouring
We held each other tight
Before the night was over
You looked over your shoulder
Oh, I was doing fine
You said, "Remember that night? Remember that night?"
Oh, I was doing fine
You said, "Remember that night? Remember that night?"
[Outro]
Do you remember?
Remember?8Embed

songs.title: Chosen Last

description.plain:
Sara originally wrote this as a reply to a comment on TikTok, asking her to:

 …write a song about being the friend who’s always left out

On July 20th, she commented on the post, which stated:

working on a full version ! will post on here when it’s released , but i post more updates on my insta

And confirmed the release date of “Chosen Last” on July 29th

songs.embed_content: Read “Chosen Last” by Sara Kays on Genius

body.plain:
Sara originally wrote this as a reply to a comment on TikTok, asking her to:

 …write a song about being the friend who’s always left out

On July 20th, she commented on the post, which stated:

working on a full version ! will post on here when it’s released , but i post more updates on my insta

And confirmed the release date of “Chosen Last” on July 29th

songs.lyrics:
16 ContributorsChosen Last Lyrics[Verse 1]
Inside jokes that I never know, but I
Still laugh until I cry
Group photos but I'm standing off to the side
I'm just camera shy

[Pre-Chorus]
Always at the birthday parties
(Always at the birthday parties)
But never close to anybody

[Chorus]
I've been chosen last since the kindergarten
Walk in the grass and it's disregarded
Fast walk to the lunch table
And pack up before I'm ready to go
I don't speak my mind, I just sit and listen
I'm there on time 'cause they won't know I'm missing
Sometimes, I would rather stay home
Than show up to be ignored and alone

[Verse 2]
Carpool everywhere, but there's never room
For me to go too
Ride my bike like all of us used to do
Oh, I don't have a clue
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
Why I'm at the birthday parties
(Why I'm at the birthday parties)
When I'm not close to anybody

[Chorus]
I've been chosen last since the kindergarten
Walk in the grass and it's disregarded
Fast walk to the lunch table
And pack up before I'm ready to go
I don't speak my mind, I just sit and listen
I'm there on time 'cause they won't know I'm missing
Sometimes, I would rather stay home
Than show up to be ignored and alone

[Bridge]
La-la-la
Ooh-ooh-ooh

[Chorus]
I've been chosen last since the kindergarten
Walk in the grass and it's disregarded
Fast walk to the lunch table
And pack up before I'm ready to go
I don't speak my mind, I just sit and listen
I'm there on time 'cause they won't know I'm missing
Sometimes, I would rather stay home
Than show up to be ignored and alone5Embed

songs.lyrics:
15 ContributorsSmaller Than This Lyrics[Verse 1]
I wake up early, sometimes at 5:30 to run
My mom got too worried, I had to tell her it was fun

[Pre-Chorus]
Oh, I feel like a failure if I don't skip breakfast and lunch
I'm chasing a body I know that I'll never outrun

[Chorus]
'Cause I'll always wish I was smaller than this
And I just can't quit pulling at my skin
Oh, I'm scared that I'm never gonna like
How I look and I wish I knew why
'Cause I'll always wish I was smaller than this

[Verse 2]
I'll set a goal for myself and I'll try to work hard
I'll reach it but swear I look just like I did from the start

[Pre-Chorus]
I know that it's not true but I feel like I'm the only one
Who's chasing a body I know that I'll never outrun

[Chorus]
'Cause I'll always wish I was smaller than this
And I just can't quit pulling at my skin
Oh, I'm scared that I'm never gonna like
How I look and I wish I knew why
That I'll always wish I was smaller than this
You might also like[Bridge]
I was smaller
I was smaller
I was smaller
I wish I was
I was smaller
I was smaller
I was smaller
I wish I was

[Chorus]
I'll always wish I was smaller than this (I was smaller, I was smaller)
And I just can't quit pulling at my skin (I was smaller, I was smaller)
(I was smaller, I was smaller)
Oh, I'm scared that I'm never gonna like
How I look and I wish I knew why
That I'll always wish I was smaller than this3Embed
